title: Conservation of Momentum and the Kinetic Energy Conservation
text: By the kinetic energy conservation and conservation of momentum we can get $$\frac{1}{2} m_1 {v_1}^2$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{1}{2} m_1 {v_{1'}}^2$$ + $$\frac{1}{2} m_2 {v_{2'}}^2$$, $$m_1$$ * $$v_1$$ $$=$$ $$m_1$$ * $$v_{1'}$$ * $$cos\left(\theta_{1'}\right)$$ + $$m_2$$ * $$v_{2'}$$ * $$cos\left(\theta_{2'}\right)$$, and\n$$0$$ $$=$$ $$m_1$$ * $$v_{1'}$$ * $$sin\left(\theta_{1'}\right)$$ - $$m_2$$ * $$v_{2'}$$ * $$sin\left(\theta_{2'}\right)$$. Then plug in the values and solve the system of equations for $$v_{1'}$$, $$v_{2'}$$, and $$\theta_{2'}$$.
